translation: The Lord is One and the Victory is of the True Guru.

gurmukhi: AQ sRI SsqR nwm mwlw purwx ilKXqy ]
transliteration: Ath Srishastra Naam Maalaa Puraan Likhyate||
translation: Shastra-Nama Mala Purana (the Rosary of the Names of weapons) is now composed
With the support of the primal power by the Tenth King.

gurmukhi: swNg srohI sYP As qIr qupk qlvwr ] s`qRwNqk kvcwNiq kr krIAY r`C hmwr ]1]
transliteration: Saandarohisaiph As Teer Toupak Talvaar|| Sattraantak Kavchaant(i) Kardareeai Rachchh Hamaar||1||
translation: O Lord ! Protect us by creating Saang, Sarohi, Saif (Sword), As, Teer (arrow) tupak (gun), Talwaar (sword), and other weapons and armours causing the destruction of the enemies.1.

gurmukhi: As kiRpwn DwrwDrI sYl sUP jmdwF ] kvcwNqk s`qRwNq kr qyg qIr DrbwF ]2]
transliteration: As Kridaan Dhaaraabaadh Sail Sooph Jamdaadh|| Kavchaantak Sattraant Kar Teg Teer Dharbaadh||2||
translation: O Lord ! Creat As, Kripan (sword), Dharaddhari, Sail, Soof, Jamaadh, Tegh (saber), Teer (saber), Teer (arrow), Talwar(sward), causing the destruction of armours and enemies.2.

gurmukhi: As kiRpwn KMfo KVg qupk qbr Aru qIr ] sYP srohI sYhQI XhY hmwrY pIr ]3]
transliteration: As Kridaan Khando Khadag Toupak Tabar Ar(u) Teer|| Saiphdarohisaihathiyahaihamdarai Peer||3||
translation: As, Kripan (sword), Khanda, Khadag (sword), Tupak (gun), Tabar (hatched), Teer (arrow), Saif (sword), Sarohi and Saihathi, all these are our adorable seniors.3.

gurmukhi: qIr quhI sYhQI quhI quhI qbr qlvwr ] nwm iqhwro jo jpY Bey isMD Bv pwr ]4]
transliteration: Teer Tuhisaihathituhituhitabar Talvaar|| Naam Tihdaro Jo Japai Bhae Sindh Bhav Paar||4||
translation: Thou are the Teer (arrow), Thou are Saihathi, Thou art Tabar (hatchet), and Talwaar (sword); he, who remembers Thy Name crosses the dreadful ocean of existence.4.

gurmukhi: kwl quhI kwlI quhI quhI qyg Aru qIr ] quhI inSwnI jIq kI Awju quhI jgbIr ]5]
transliteration: Kaal Tuhikaalituhiteg Ar(u) Teer|| Tuhinishaanijeet Kiaaj(u) Tuhijagheer||5||
translation: Thou art the KAL (death), thou art the goddess Kali, Thou art the saber and arrow, Thou art the sign of victory today and Thou art the Hero of the world.5.

gurmukhi: quhI sUl sYhQI qbr qUM inKMg Aru bwn ] quhI ktwrI syl sB qumhI krd kiRpwn ]6]
transliteration: Tuhisool Saihathitabar Toon Nidhan Ar(u) Baan|| Tuhikataarisel Sabh Toum-hikarad Kridaan||6||
translation: Thou art the Sool (spike), Saihathi and Tabar (hatched), Thou art the Nikhang and Baan (arrow), Thou art the Kataari, Sel, and all and Thou art the Kard (knife), and Kripaan (sword).6.

gurmukhi: SsqR AsqR qumhI ispr qumhI kvc inKMg ] kvcwNqk qumhI bny qum bXwpk srbMg ]7]
transliteration: Shastra Astra Toum-hisipar Toum-hikavach Nidhadg|| Kavchaantak Toum-hibade Toum Byaapak Sarban||7||
translation: Thou art the arms and weapons, Thou art the Nikhang (quiver), and the Kavach (armour); Thou art the destroyer of the armours and Thou art also all pervading.7.

gurmukhi: sRI qUM sB kwrn quhI qUM ib`dXw ko swr ] qum sB ko auprwjhI qumhI lyhu aubwr ]8]
transliteration: Sritoon Sabh Kaaran Tuhitoon Biddyaa Ko Saar|| Toum Sabh Ko Oupraaj-hitoum-hilehu Oubaar||8||
translation: Thou art the cause of peace and prosperity and the essence of learning; Thou art the creator of all and the redeemer of all.8.

gurmukhi: qumhI idn rjnI quhI qumhI jIAn aupwie ] kauqk hyrn ky nimq iqn mo bwd bFwie ]9]
transliteration: Toum-hidin Rajnituhitoum-hijian Oupaae|| Kaoutak Deran Ke Namit Tim No Baad Badhaae||9||
translation: Thou art the day and night and Thou art the creator of all the Jivas (beings), causing disputes among them; Thou does all this in order to view Thy own sport.9.
